metadata.synopsis: "Kadosh" examines Mea Shearim, a Jerusalem neighborhood which guards itself and its ultra-orthodox inhabitants from the flow of contemporary urbanity or tourist populations. A classically constructed chamber piece, "Kadosh" features only seven characters, specifically revolving around the relationship between two sisters and three men.

reviews: An unforgettably emotional film, as the love between the lead characters becomes shot through with tension, guilt and jealousy.
An incredibly sensitive Israeli film about the harsh effects of religious zealotry.
Gitai handles his potentially melodramatic material with unfailing taste and compassion, encouraging his audience to think long and hard about the moral dilemmas his film intelligently explores.
The film, directed by a longtime Israeli documentarian named Amos Gitai, sees the story largely through the eyes of the women.
The emphasis of the film is on how the ultra-Orthodox Jews of that sect live by the letter of the Torah in everything they do.
A poignantly disturbing look at the social contradictions inherent in a lifestyle bound by religious duty.
